description:
The HTML textarea element represents a multi-line plain-text editing control, useful when you
want to allow users to enter a sizeable amount of free-form text, for example a comment on a
review or feedback form. Textarea uses textarea styles for error and disabled states.
name: Textarea - Styles
usage:
Tag specifies an input field where the user can enter data. For accessibility, make sure the label element has 'for' attribute and input element has 'id' attribute to match. The size of a text area can be specified by the cols and rows attributes. Use the 'disabled' attribute on the textarea element and the textbox--disabled class to apply styles for the disabled state. Use the 'aria-invalid="true"' attribute on the textarea element and the textbox--error class to apply styles for the error state. ```html
